title: Senior Backend Engineer - Product (SR 0820)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by being incredibly trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

What we are looking for

We are looking for Software Engineers with a strong technical background and a “get-things-done” attitude who are eager to learn new exciting technologies to join our Core Product.

Examples of work you might undertake

  • Develop our content management system (codenamed "Earth"), used to maintain specs, descriptions and media for over 10M products.
  • Work on product sizes detection and conversions across 150+ fashion categories, enabling filters and size guides on the Skroutz platform.
  • Optimize our product categorization and clustering pipelines, used to classify over 30k new products daily.
  • Improve the extraction of product attributes (e.g. brand, color, model number) from product titles, descriptions or other semi-structured data.
  • Help automate any time-consuming manual procedure that a machine can perform more efficiently.
requirements:
What skills and experience you will need

  • At least (5) years of working experience as a Software Engineer in a professional setting.
  • A solid CS background.
  • Intrigued by the product as much as by the technology.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication skills and team spirit.

We will appreciate if you have

  • Good knowledge of Ruby/Ruby on Rails is a huge plus.
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks/UI libraries (preferably React).
  • Solid understanding of web architecture.
  • Strong knowledge of database systems (relational, document-based, etc).
  • Familiarity with OOP principles and design patterns.
  • Comfort with TDD and other testing practices.
  • Exposure to architectural patterns and the production system of a large, performance-intensive web application.
  • Contributed to open-source projects
  • Shareable open source contributions or personal projects which will help us in the evaluation process.

title: Reviews and Community Curator (RC 1020)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by being incredibly trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

We are looking for a Reviews & Community Curator to help our users get the most out of the available public reviews, and ensure that the quality of the user-generated content (UGC) meets our users’ expectations.

As a Reviews & Community Curator, you’ll join our UGC team, responsible for driving customer engagement through our User Generated Content.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Ensuring that the daily thousands product reviews and user discussions are going to be published according to our terms and conditions.
  • Take appropriate action to inform our users about any necessary changes on their published content in a timely manner to meet or exceed their expectations.
  • Providing Skroutz’s users with the necessary information, support, and guidance for making the best use of our platform and its features, by interacting with them via various channels of communication -like emails, facebook messages, and inhouse tools.
  • Articulate technical issues, such as reproducing bugs and user remarks, to determine their accuracy, so that you could effectively relay to the rest of the team when needed.
  • Follow the team’s structure on monitoring, organising and analyzing users' feedback & go the extra mile to engage customers.
requirements:
• Excellent copywriting skills both in Greek and English.
  • Minimum 1 year in online customer support services (preferably in an eCommerce environment).
  • Outstanding communication skills with the ability to articulate technical issues (explore bugs), and active listening.
  • Detail and goal-oriented, creative individual with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize accordingly.
  • Fast-learner with empathy and positivity. Highly organized, and self-motivated worker with ability to take ownership of issues and follow through to resolution
  • Confident and outgoing personality with the ability to communicate effectively both in writing and verbally.
  • Team player, open-minded, enthusiastic and inspirational.

Nice to have skills

  • Community management in an eCommerce environment.
  • Forum moderator experience will be considered a plus.
  • Advanced Excel skills

title: Customer Support Lead - Marketplace (CL 1020)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by being incredibly trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

Our customers are at the heart of everything we do, which means that we try to always get things right for them. Our Marketplace team strives to make our customer's journey with us something we're proud of.

What We Are Looking For:

We're looking for a Support Team Lead to provide guidance to Marketplace Customer Support agents to deliver superior customer service to Skroutz users and merchants.

You’ll work with a team of 5-6 agents who operate in rotation including weekends. Your business hours will be on a traditional schedule, and you’ll need to make sure your team is aligned and has the information they need when others aren’t around.

As a Team Lead, you will need to contribute to creating a healthy inclusive team environment, guided by honesty, trust, and safety.

Some things about you:

  • Υou are results driven, persistent and can work independently
  • You can set a positive example and make sure your team is aligned with the department's goals and objectives
  • You aim to maximize individuals’ abilities through clear expectations, feedback, coaching, and recognition
  • You have an analytical mind and can identify process blockers that might be affecting the team work

Responsibilities

  • Schedule shifts
  • Answer questions from the team and provide guidance and feedback
  • Hold regular 1:1 meetings with each direct report to determine satisfaction and ensure team’s alignment
  • Address team’s concerns or performance issues as needed
  • Address customer issues and complaints, taking ownership of escalations and following problems through to resolution
  • Take on more complex operational support tasks
  • Work with management to assess and improve processes and policies and minimize reactive support
requirements:
What skills and experience you will need:

Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Proven experience of successfully leading a team for at least 1 year
  • Familiarity with customer service tools and CRM systems
  • Experience working with Zendesk will be considered a plus

Skills

  • Strong empathetic skills and the ability to put yourself in someone’s shoes
  • Strong customer centricity and focus on customer experience and satisfaction
  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills with customer service focus

Experience

  • Excellent Portfolio of UI/UX design solutions across a spectrum of platforms and services

  • Degree in Digital or Graphic Design (optional)

Skills

  • Familiarity with Abstract, Zeplin, Photoshop, Illustrator, prototyping tools

**Please note that this opening concerns an onsite job, located in Athens, Attica, Greece.

title: Senior Security Engineer - Platform (SC 1220)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by being incredibly trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

What we are looking for

We are looking for a Senior Security Engineer with a Software Engineering background to join our Security Team at Skroutz. The Security Team is part of our Platform division and aims to assist the development teams produce secure code and help the rest of the Platform division secure our infrastructure.

Examples of work you might undertake

  • Integrate security tools (e.g. dynamic or static analysis tools) in the development process to achieve SDLC
  • Conduct security assessments for internal and external-facing applications
  • Harden the basic OS image we use on our servers
  • Identify threats and provide guidance on hardening a new service
  • Develop and maintain internal tools around security and integrate 3rd party security solutions (e.g. automated security update rollout, infrastructure security intelligence gathering, IAM platform etc.)
  • Continuously educate developer teams around security concepts
  • Assess third-party software & services for inclusion in our infrastructure
requirements:
What skills and experience you will need

  • At least 4 years of working experience as a Security Engineer/Security Analyst or on a relevant security position, in a professional setting
  • A solid CS background, accompanied by a genuine interest in cybersecurity, continuously growing your skills & knowledge
  • Good working knowledge of at least one programming language (Ruby and/or Python will be considered a plus)
  • Familiarity with Linux & Windows from a security viewpoint and relevant security hardening experience
  • Prior experience with security assessments in mixed environments (whitebox or blackbox penetration testing etc.)
  • Prior experience is security code reviews and drafting of security technical reports
  • Ability to own a cybersecurity project end-to-end, including researching, designing the architecture, implementing, integrating, testing, deploying & monitoring a solution
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills, being a team player
  • Ability to inspire and motivate a team to achieve individual and company­ goals
  • Lead-by-example mentality
We will appreciate if you have
  • Worked as a DevSecOps or Full-Stack web developer in a professional setting
  • Experience in at least one of the following fields: mobile application security, cloud security, container & virtualization security
  • Experience in utilizing common cybersecurity tools (BurpSuite, Nmap, Nikto, Metasploit/Empire, Nessus/OpenVAS, SIEMs etc.)
  • Acquired & currently hold relevant security certifications (OSCP, OSWE, CEH, CISSP etc.)
  • Contributed to open-source projects; sharing contributions or personal projects will help us in the evaluation process.
